review: I have been using Amazon Fire TV for a few days now. So far it does what it promised with a couple of small hiccups.Pros: The device is small, sleek and beautiful. Best part is the remote which does not need a line of sight to be used. Just press the button pointing in any direction and it works. The interface is simple and it works great. I subscribed for Sling TV and it works great on this device. The quality is definitely HD and it has no problem displaying it.Cons: I did not see a button on the remote to power off the device. It does go to the sleep mode, but I do not know if that can be turned off without plugging its power cord out. There is no volume control on the remote. So you have to keep both TV and FireTV remotes with you which is kind of inconvenient. Roku3 provides a audio jack on the remote to attach headphones, but there is no such jack on FireTV's remote.Not used yet: There is a USB port on the device. I am not sure if I can plug in a usb drive to play my videos through this device. There is a microphone on the remote to issue voice commands. I will try these out and will update the review.
